text:
<!everyone> hey folks! we have some cool new roles today. just FYI the salary report will be published next week. here's one more teaser: freelancers earned ~$14,000 more than full-timers in 2021. nice job freelancers!!
---
okays, jobs!
:tv: = includes a video Q&A
:zap:️ = new this week
---
:star:*️ featured full-time roles:*
---

:v: jimmy

text: love your salary reports, thanks for putting these together <@UJG9WTEKG>. i'm curious does the freelance income specify if it's net income or gross?

elements.text: love your salary reports, thanks for putting these together
. i'm curious does the freelance income specify if it's net income or gross?

text: That's an awesome data point! My first thought was "WOOHOO!" and my second thought was, "well, they'd have to earn more because #taxes and expenses." One of my big takeaways from year 2 of working for myself was how much it costs to run a business (and to work with corporates). It's not free to freelance!

elements.text: That's an awesome data point! My first thought was "WOOHOO!" and my second thought was, "well, they'd have to earn more because #taxes and expenses." One of my big takeaways from year 2 of working for myself was how much it costs to run a business (and to work with corporates). It's not free to freelance!

text:
<@UJG9WTEKG> - Also love the salary report, as it uniquely demonstrates the market value for content!

Potentially opening a can of worms here (sorry!), but does the FTE vs. freelance comparison contextualize or account for cost of employer benefits, ancillary perks, etc.? and could there a be third category for those hustlers who combine FTE + freelance?

elements.text:
- Also love the salary report, as it uniquely demonstrates the market value for content!

Potentially opening a can of worms here (sorry!), but does the FTE vs. freelance comparison contextualize or account for cost of employer benefits, ancillary perks, etc.? and could there a be third category for those hustlers who combine FTE + freelance?

text: <@U01EJ7VE9FD> it does not. we have enough freelancers tho that i think we'll need to start collecting more robust data. and maybe even need to split this into two reports, one for FT and one for freelance

elements.text: it does not. we have enough freelancers tho that i think we'll need to start collecting more robust data. and maybe even need to split this into two reports, one for FT and one for freelance

text: <@U01DEA6F7CH> yea that's a great point. we didn't collect data on that this year. i think we may need to create two separate reports next year

elements.text: yea that's a great point. we didn't collect data on that this year. i think we may need to create two separate reports next year

text: <@U01QV2VLNMQ> we did collect some data on benefits but specifically asked for take home pay

elements.text: we did collect some data on benefits but specifically asked for take home pay

text: Love to see content getting the recognition (and compensation!) it deserves  :clap:

elements.text: Love to see content getting the recognition (and compensation!) it deserves
